name: Annapurna Black Ale
description: As the fires in the hearth have started and the days are shortened, there is a cold, dark feeling in this “shoulder season”.  The seasonal beer goes through the same progression. We wanted to make a darker beer that had a lot of hop character blending the recent harvest with the upcoming winter.  To accomplish the feat we used plenty of de-bittered black malt and Cascadian style hops. To accompany the shoulder season, the beer retains a thinner body with a nice blend of NW hops and the dark malts. We’ll call it a NW Black ale, as opposed to a Cascadian dark ale, since Annapurna has more dark malts that share the stage with the hop character.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.
